INDICATOR: Estimated population aged 65 years and over by sex and year ('000)
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: This is a duplicate - delete it

INDICATOR: Number and proportion of population aged 65 years and over
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The total number and percentage of people in the population who are aged 65 years or older.

INDICATOR: Number of homeless persons aged 65 years and over
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of people aged 65 years and over who are in accomodation designated for the homeless or sleeping rough.

INDICATOR: Number of Travellers aged 65 years and over
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of people from the Traveller community who are aged 65 years or older.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults (65 years and over) who are in receipt of home care package
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years or over receiving organised care services in their own home, such as personal care or nursing.

INDICATOR: Deprivation distribution by 8-point Pobal HP index for those aged 65 and over
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: How adults aged 65 years and over are spread across different levels of social and economic disadvantage in an area, based on the Pobal HP Deprivation Index.  The Pobal HP Deprivation Index is Ireland's primary social gradient tool.  Based on the latest Census information (in this case Census 2022) it reveals the profile of communities across Ireland. The Pobal HP Deprivation Index uses data from Census 2022, analysing ten measures of an area’s levels of disadvantage. These include educational attainment, employment status and the numbers living in individual households.

INDICATOR: Ethnicity of those aged 65 years and over
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The ethnic background or identity of people aged 65 years and over.

INDICATOR: Persons who smoke: Proportion of population aged 65 years and over who smoked tobacco. (Displayed as: Yes - daily;  Yes - occasionally; No - have given up smoking; Never)
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: ok to leave in reference to 'Displayed as: Yes - daily;  Yes - occasionally; No - have given up smoking; Never)_
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of  people  aged 65 years and over who currently smoke, used to smoke, or have never smoked.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults (aged 65 years and over) who reported a fall in the previous two years
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of adults aged 65 years and over who said they had a fall or trip in the last two years.

INDICATOR: Number of inpatient stays in older adults aged 65 years and over in the last year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of times people aged 65 years and over were admitted to hospital and stayed overnight in the past year.

INDICATOR: Length of inpatient stays  in older adults aged 65 years and over in the last year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The average number of days that adults aged 65 years and over spent in hospital during inpatient admissions during the last year

INDICATOR: Number of persons aged 65 years and over usually resident in a nursing home home/residential facility or hospital by sex and census year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of people aged 65 years and older who live long-term in care facilities or hospitals.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who have a cardiovascular disease
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of adults aged 65 years and over who have a heart-related illness such as heart attack, angina, or stroke.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who report severe or moderate pain most of the time
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of people aged 65 years and over who regularly experience moderate or severe pain.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over with depression (CESD-8)
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years and over who report symptoms of depression, measured using a standard survey tool.

INDICATOR: Number of outpatient visits in older adults aged 65 years and over in the last year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of times adults aged 65 years and over attended hospital appointments, but without being admitted overnight, in the past year.

INDICATOR: Number of Persons aged 65 years and over living alone in private households
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of adults aged 65 years and over who live by themselves in their own home or apartment.

INDICATOR: Percentage of persons aged 65 years and over living alone in private households
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years and overwho live alone in private homes.

INDICATOR: Number of Emergency Department visits in older adults aged 65 years and over in the last year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of times people aged 65 years and over went to the hospital Emergency Department in the past year.

INDICATOR: Percentage of Persons aged 65 years and over with a Disability
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years and over who report having a disability that affects their daily life.

INDICATOR: Healthy Life Years (HLY) at age 65 years
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of years a person aged 65 years can expect to live in good health without a serious illness or disability.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who have a chronic disease
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of  people aged 65 years and over living with one or more long-term health conditions such as diabetes, arthritis, or heart disease.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who are in receipt of home help
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of people aged 65 years and over receiving basic support services at home like cleaning, shopping, or help with daily tasks.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who are in receipt of Meals-on-Wheels
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years and over who receive ready-to-eat meals delivered to their homes.

INDICATOR: Projected population aged 65 years and over by age group and year using the M2 projection scenario
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: Explanation of M2 project scenario definition. DMcK done. Decision made 01.07.25 to remove ('000)
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Estimated future numbers of people aged 65 years and over based on national population projections (M2 scenario). M2 assumption for population projection: this is an assumption for the purposes of predicting population growth, in which the presumed migration is at a moderate level.

INDICATOR: Percentage of people 65 and above with a confirmed long-term condition
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: This is a duplicate - delete it

INDICATOR: Number of people aged aged 65 years and over who are blind or have a visual impairment
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of people aged 65 years and over who report being blind or having difficulty seeing even with glasses.

INDICATOR: Number of GP visits in older adults aged 65 years and over in the last year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of times people aged 65 years and over visited a general practitioner (GP) in the past year.

INDICATOR: Percentage of people aged 65 years and over who have been admitted to hospital as an inpatient by sex and year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years and over who were admitted to hospital overnight or longer, shown by sex and year.

INDICATOR: Number of people aged 65 years and over in receipt of home support - OP54
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of adults aged 65 years and over who receive formal home support services under the OP54 national reporting measure.

INDICATOR: Number of people with an intellectual disability aged 65 years and over
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of adults aged 65 years and over who have a diagnosed intellectual disability.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who report problematic alcohol use (CAGE measure)

DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The percentage of adults aged 65 years and over who may have alcohol-related problems based on the CAGE screening questionnaire.

INDICATOR: Percentage of people aged 65 years and over with a GP Visit card or Medical Card
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of  adults aged 65 years and over who are eligible for free or subsidised healthcare under state schemes.

INDICATOR: Percentage of older adults aged 65 years and over who are taking five or more medications
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of adults aged 65 years and over who are on five or more prescribed medications (known as polypharmacy).

INDICATOR: Population by general health.  Self-reported general health of older adults aged 65 years and over (Displayed  as: Very good; Good; Fair; Bad; Very bad; Not stated)
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of adults aged 65 years and over who rate their own general health, from very good to very bad.

INDICATOR: Ischaemic stroke discharge rate per 1,000 population aged 65 years and over

DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The number of adults aged 65 years and over who have been discharged from hospital after a stroke caused by a blocked artery, per 1,000 population aged 65 years and over.

INDICATOR: Housing tenure status by age group of reference person and census year
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of adults aged 65 years and over who own or rent their home, or have another housing arrangement, by age group.

INDICATOR: Carers by sex: Proportion of the population aged 65 years and over providing regular unpaid care or support to a family member, neighbour or friend with a long-term illness, old age or a disability. Displayed as: Female; Male.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of people aged 65 years and over who regularly provide unpaid care or help, shown separately for men and women.

INDICATOR: Proportion of Population aged 65 years and over by social class and sex.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: The proportion of people aged 65 years and over, by occupational social class and sex.

INDICATOR: Number and proportion of population aged 65 years and over (projected)

INDICATOR: Projected Dependency Ratios from 2022
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: definiton for projected dependency ratio - DMk- done
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Estimates showing the possible future number of people aged 65 years and over, compared to those of working age, used to plan future services. Dependency ratio: The dependency ratio is a demographic indicator that compares the number of people considered to be dependents (too young or too old to be in the workforce) to the number of people considered to be in the working-age population. It essentially measures the burden on the working population to support the non-working age groups ( can be calculated by adding people aged 0-15 to those aged 65+ and dividing the whole lot by people aged 16-64 years)

INDICATOR: Total number of new referrals to ICPOP (accepted) by month
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo:
ICPOP indicator added by request Mary Browne 06.05.2025. Indicator is part of ICPOP suite of KPI's collected monthly.
Unique ID generated using the actual KPI Number (i.e.) 'CST' and a 'number', and for ease Teresa prefaced the code with 'ICPOP'.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Monthly total of new referrals accepted into the ICPOP programme.
RESPONDENT 1: This KPI includes all referrals accepted to the ICPOP Community Specialist Teams within the month. For the purposes of this KPI, new referrals include patients who are discharged and referred again to each ICPOP CST in the month up to and including the last date of the month. For the purpose of this includes referrals that have been triaged and accepted.

INDICATOR: Total number of new ICPOP referrals by referral source by month
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo:
ICPOP indicator added by request Mary Browne 06.05.2025. Indicator is part of ICPOP suite of KPI's collected monthly.
This indicator is the summation of 9 different KPI's - see definition.
Unique ID generated using the actual KPI Number (i.e.) 'CST' and a 'number', and for ease Teresa prefaced the code with 'ICPOP'.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Monthly total of new ICPOP referrals, broken down by which clinical specialty the referral came from.
RESPONDENT 1: This indicator is an aggregation of KPI's CST 3.01 - 3.08 and KPI CST 8.02.  It includes all referrals received from GPs, CHN, NAS and/or Pathfinder teams, Frailty at the Front Door (or similar) service, Geriatric Medicine teams, received from ED (broken down by the month), Acute Inpatient Floor,  new referrals accepted  to the ICPOP Community Specialist Team for older adults in Residential Care Facilities, and from Other Sources within the month.

INDICATOR: Total number of new ICPOP referrals with a clinical frailty score of 3 or less (not frail)
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: As above, but note this frailty indicator is the summation of KPI CST 5.01, CST5.02 and CST 5.03. - see definition.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Monthly referrals to ICPOP for people aged 65 years and over with low or no frailty.
RESPONDENT 1: This includes total number of new patients with a frailty scores with a clinical frailty score of 3 or less (not frail).

INDICATOR: Total number of new ICPOP referrals with a clinical frailty score of 4-6 (mild frailty)
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: As above, but note this frailty indicator is the summation of KPI CST 5.04, CST5.05 and CST 5.06. - see definition.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Monthly referrals to ICPOP for people aged 65 years and over with mild levels of frailty.
RESPONDENT 1: This includes total number of new patients with a frailty scores with a clinical frailty score of 4-6 (mild frailty).

INDICATOR: Total number of new ICPOP referrals with a clinical frailty score of 7-8 (moderate frailty)
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: As above, but note this frailty indicator is the summation of KPI CST 5.07 and CST 5.08. - see definition.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Monthly referrals to ICPOP for people aged 65 years and over with moderate frailty.
RESPONDENT 1: This includes total number of new patients with a frailty scores with a clinical frailty score of 7-8 (moderate frailty).

INDICATOR: Total number of new ICPOP referrals with a clinical frailty score of 9 (advanced frailty)
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: As above.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Monthly referrals to ICPOP for people aged 65 years and over with the highest level of frailty.
RESPONDENT 1: This includes total number of new patients with a clinical frailty score of 9 (advanced frailty).

INDICATOR: Total number of new patients seen by ICPOP on 10 or more medications by month
NOTES Thur 26th June - 2nd refinement fo: ICPOP indicator added by request Mary Browne 06.05.2025.
DEFINITIONS/What we mean: Number of adults aged 65 years and over seen by ICPOP each month who take 10 or more medications.
RESPONDENT 1: Total number of new patients seen by ICPOP on 10 or more medications by month
